verbs.description: [ARGM-LOC: Along America 's Southwest border] , [ARG0: illegal immigrants] [V: crossed] [ARGM-DIR: into the U.S.] [ARGM-DIR: from Mexico] [ARGM-TMP: in April] [ARGM-ADV: at a rate 233 percent higher than the same month last year] . Data from the Department of Homeland Security showed that roughly 39,000 illegal immigrants were apprehended by Border Patrol last month , more than doubling the number picked up in April 2017 . Brandon Judd , president of the National Border Patrol Council , provided an explanation , saying , " The reason is obvious : If you can cross the border illegally without any consequence , why not ? As long as the catch - and - release policy - program exists , large numbers of people are going to cross the border illegally . " Judd speculated that roughly 75 percent of the individuals apprehended by Border Patrol are released in the U.S. due to the catch - and - release protocol . Following President Donald Trump 's inauguration , the number of migrants crossing into the U.S. illegally took a huge drop . In fact , Judd says , " In 2017 and due to the …

Along America 's Southwest border , illegal immigrants crossed into the U.S. from Mexico in April at a rate 233 percent higher than the same month last year . [ARG0: Data from the Department of Homeland Security] [V: showed] [ARG1: that roughly 39,000 illegal immigrants were apprehended by Border Patrol last month , more than doubling the number picked up in April 2017] . As long as the catch - and - release policy - program exists , large numbers of people are going to cross the border illegally . " Judd speculated that roughly 75 percent of the individuals apprehended by Border Patrol are released in the U.S. due to the catch - and - release protocol . Following President Donald Trump 's inauguration , the number of migrants crossing into the U.S. illegally took a huge drop . In fact , Judd says , " In 2017 and due to the …

Along America 's Southwest border , illegal immigrants crossed into the U.S. from Mexico in April at a rate 233 percent higher than the same month last year . Data from the Department of Homeland Security showed that roughly 39,000 illegal immigrants [V: were] apprehended by Border Patrol last month , more than doubling the number picked up in April 2017 . Brandon Judd , president of the National Border Patrol Council , provided an explanation , saying , " The reason is obvious : If you can cross the border illegally without any consequence , why not ? As long as the catch - and - release policy - program exists , large numbers of people are going to cross the border illegally . " Judd speculated that roughly 75 percent of the individuals apprehended by Border Patrol are released in the U.S. due to the catch - and - release protocol . Following President Donald Trump 's inauguration , the number of migrants crossing into the U.S. illegally took a huge drop . In fact , Judd says , " In 2017 and due to the …
